Video in a Magazine

Posted to Mottr.am by
Jack
on 21 August 2009. Tags: advertising future
Short URL: http://mottr.am/v

In the latest issue of Entertainment Weekly magazine, there is a video advertisement.

  1. I bet people will do some really cool stuff with this free miniaturised video-playing hardware.
  2. This is the first time something as eye-gougingly annoying as a web pop-up has appeared in a print publication; it won’t be the last.
  3. Can you imagine how cool the lyrics pages in Smash Hits would’ve been with embedded music videos?

Commenting via Twitter

If you have a Twitter account and would like to reply to this post, just tweet what you'd like to say, and make sure to put #mot_v somewhere in your tweet.

The gobbledygook beginning with '#' is called a 'hashtag', and makes it easy for this site to search Twitter for your tweet, and display it on the correct page.

Alternatively, you can tweet about this post and include its short URL, http://mottr.am/v, and your tweet will be displayed automatically, whether you use the hashtag or not.

If you don't have a Twitter account, feel free to send me an email instead, and I'll update the post with your comments: j@ck.mottr.am
